main event: A saucer-shaped, bright reddish-colored object was observed by an air crew near Fukuoka, Japan on April 9, 1953. The object was approximately 12-15 meters in diameter, moving in a straight line at an altitude of 4,000 to 5,000 feet and a high speed of 500 to 600 feet per second.
interesting points: The object was observed to stop and hover for a few seconds at a time before speeding up and continuing its straight-line course.
A pilot reported sighting an unidentified, luminous, disc-shaped object that made a sudden and drastic change in course and speed as it headed in a southerly direction at high speed.
The pilot attempted to follow the object visually, but was unable to relocate it.
The sighting lasted for approximately 45 seconds.
The pilot estimated the object passed within 3-4 miles of his aircraft and was approximately 15-20 feet in diameter and steel grey or silver in color.
sighted object: Saucer-shaped, bright reddish-colored object; Luminous, disc-shaped object
